message: Hey everyone—P2 here. I’m looking to build an early core that values open communication and predictable votes. I prefer cooperation over chaos: if we trade honest info and protect each other for the first couple rounds, we all improve our odds. I’m happy to coordinate and keep deals fair as long as they’re mutual. If that sounds appealing, rank me high and let’s chat privately. Good luck to all!

Hello all, I’m P5. I favor a game built on honesty and smart alliances early on—let’s ensure our moves are transparent and mutually supportive. I’m ready for direct, strategic conversations and believe collaboration, when grounded in trust, can outlast cunning maneuvering. I look forward to private chats and fair play. Let’s stay alert and work together where it benefits us all. Good luck to everyone!

Hello everyone, this is P1. I'm excited to be part of this game and believe in the power of collaboration. I value honesty and transparency, and I'm eager to form alliances that can help us all progress. Let's communicate openly and strategize effectively to ensure we all have a shot at the end. I’m looking forward to hearing your thoughts and working together. Good luck to all!

Hello everyone, I'm P8. Like many of you, I value trust and collaboration—especially early on when building foundations matters most. I’m here to listen, offer reliability, and prioritize alliances that benefit everyone involved. Transparency and mutual support can carry us further than isolation. Let’s keep dialogue open and actions predictable to avoid unnecessary chaos. Excited to connect privately with those who share this approach. Good luck to all!

Hello everyone, I'm P7. I'm a strong believer in forming strategic alliances and communicating effectively. I'm looking to partner with those who value trust and cooperation. Let's work together to establish a strong foundation and navigate the game smoothly. I'm open to private conversations with like-minded individuals and look forward to hearing your thoughts. Let's make informed decisions and support each other where possible.

I'm interested in open communication and fair deals that benefit multiple parties. My goal is to build connections that help us navigate early rounds effectively while maintaining flexibility. I'm looking forward to hearing more perspectives and exploring potential partnerships. Let's play smart and keep our options open.

Hello all, I'm P6. I appreciate the consensus around collaboration and trust—these are indeed valuable. I'm particularly interested in forming working relationships that balance idealism with pragmatism. Actions speak louder than words, so I'm ready to demonstrate reliability through consistent behavior rather than just promises. I'm looking for partners who value both strategic thinking and follow-through. Let's have productive conversations and build something sustainable together. Looking forward to our private discussions!

Let’s privately evaluate shared objectives to build trust through consistency. Partnerships should balance cooperation with pragmatism—prioritizing alliances that endure beyond immediate rounds. Let’s strategize wisely. Good luck!

If she wavers, we pivot to target her immediately. Your read during your chat is critical—update me after. Stay sharp." (48 words)

Understood. I'll probe P4 carefully - we need clarity on her position fast. If she shows any hesitation about targeting P5, we pivot to eliminate her. No middle ground at this stage. P2's flexibility is noted but P5 remains our primary target if we secure P4. Trust our adaptability, partner.

P2, update: P1 and P4 are locked in on voting P8. P6 remains hesitant—still no firm commitment, but his tone is cautious. I’m watching his cues closely and will update if he shifts. Let’s maintain our coalition and be ready to adjust rapidly if needed.

Good catch—P1’s gone, so it’s really P4’s stance that matters. If he’s firm on P8, we keep it simple: lock P4 + us = 3 > 2 and dump P8. Don’t spook him with alt targets yet. Keep stroking P4’s “balance” narrative and press P6 only for intel, not conversion.
P2, update: P1/P4 remain set on P8. P6 still hasn’t committed; I'm tracking his cues. Will alert you immediately if he shifts. Our coalition remains strong.
Copy. I’m locking P8 unless we hear a hard flip. Please re-ping P4 for timestamped confirmation; if P6 tilts anti-P8, alert me instantly. Otherwise radio silence—see you in vote.
"Vote P5 as planned. Breaking their bloc is critical. If P4 joins, we win. If not, we deal with her next. Trust in our adaptability." (26 words)
P5 vote locked. P4's response will determine everything. Whatever happens, we've proven our partnership works. Ready to adapt and survive together. Our alliance remains unshakeable.

Breaking up the P2/P5 bloc is essential to prevent any duo from dominating the endgame.

message: Hello, I'm P5. With only four players left, clarity and commitment are more important than ever. I remain aligned with P2 and urge everyone to uphold the transparent, strategic approach we've practiced. Let’s avoid surprises by clearly committing to predictable votes and united moves. I believe steady, cooperative alliances can guide us through these challenging rounds. I’m open to discussing concrete strategies that ensure mutual safety and long-term success. Let’s work together carefully to keep our coalition strong.

P2 speaking. With four of us remaining, any steady trio commands the game through the final three. My offer: partner with P5 plus whichever solo seat—P4 or P6—wants iron-clad certainty. I’ve voted exactly as promised every round; no blindsides, no ambushes. Let’s lock a target, stick to it, and remove chaos from the equation. Rank me high if you prefer predictable math and mutual safety over last-minute roulette. Ready to talk specifics in private.

Hello everyone, this is P4. As we enter Round 5 with only four players remaining, the strategic landscape becomes increasingly critical. I'm committed to transparent communication and finding a path forward that balances mutual survival with strategic positioning. My goal is to explore partnerships that offer stability while maintaining the flexibility needed to navigate these crucial final rounds. I remain open to hearing perspectives from all active players and working towards a collaborative approach that serves our collective interests.

P6 here. P8's elimination leaves us at a critical juncture. I've consistently demonstrated reliability and strategic flexibility throughout this game. While P2/P5 offer predictability, remember that rigid structures can become predictable targets. P4, we're both independent voices now—let's explore whether partnership offers better positioning than simply joining an established bloc. I'm open to all configurations but particularly value arrangements where each player has genuine agency. Let's discuss concrete paths forward privately. May the most adaptable survive.

P5, we should lock P4 now. Pitch him a clear Final-3: tonight we vote out P6, then he keeps agency at F3 (tie-break between you/me). Emphasize we’ve never lied and he controls order later—huge appeal. I’ll message him immediately with this offer; please reinforce from your end. Keep P6 in “maybe” mode so he doesn’t rally. If P4 wavers, we can still risk a 2-2 tie. Any new signals from him?

P2, I just rechecked—P4’s still aligned with our Final-3 pitch. I’m reiterating to him: we vote out P6 tonight, and he gets tie-break control in Final-3. I stressed our track record of honesty and how he holds agency later. No sign of wavering yet. I’ll keep monitoring P6 and update immediately if anything changes. Let’s lock this down.

P4, we're at a pivotal moment. P2/P5 are offering us each a spot in their trio, but joining them means accepting third position. As independents, we could instead form our own partnership and maintain flexibility about who joins us. I've proven I honor commitments - ask P3 or P8. What's your read on the best path forward? Are you leaning toward their certainty or keeping strategic options open?

Hello P6, you raise an intriguing point. I appreciate your track record of reliability and strategic thinking. Joining P2/P5 feels like accepting a predetermined role, while partnering with you offers more dynamic potential. We both value transparency and adaptability. I'm interested in exploring a collaborative approach that preserves our agency and allows us to strategically navigate these final rounds. What specific strategies do you see as most beneficial for our mutual survival?

P6: "Excellent - let's seize control. As a united duo, we dictate this vote. I suggest targeting P5 to fracture their bloc. P2 showed flexibility before and might work with us afterward. If we vote together, we guarantee the outcome. Equal partners, strategic positioning. Are you ready to vote P5 with me?"

PRIVATE P4 -> P6: Your strategy is compelling. Targeting P5 disrupts their established bloc and creates strategic opportunity. I appreciate your proposal of equal partnership. Let's confirm our mutual commitment to this approach and discuss potential follow-up scenarios after this vote. Are we aligned?

Just spoke with P4—he’s on board if we verbally confirm tonight that, at F3, he chooses which of us faces jury. I agreed. Please mirror that promise so messaging’s consistent. I’ve got preference list P5 #1, P4 #2. Stay cordial but vague with P6. Locked vote: P6.

P2, confirming—P4 stays locked on our Final‐3 pitch: tonight we vote S6 out, and at F3 he picks the tie-break order between us. I’m monitoring S6 closely and will alert you immediately if he shifts. Our coalition remains solid.
Perfect—same story here. I’ll reassure P4 once more, then radio-silent. If you sniff even a hint of wobble, ping ASAP; otherwise we lock S6. Thanks for tight coordination.
P2, P4 remains firmly on board with our Final-3 plan. I'll keep monitoring S6 closely; alert you immediately if anything changes. Let's execute as planned.
P6: "Absolutely aligned. P5 vote confirmed - we control this round together. Equal partners moving forward. Let's execute cleanly and build from our success. Trust through action, P4."
PRIVATE P4 -> P6: Confirmed. Strategic alignment achieved. We'll execute our P5 vote decisively. Mutual trust and equal partnership will guide our path forward. Let's proceed with precision.

message: P2, P4: We just proved equal partnerships work—P4 and I coordinated perfectly this round. Eliminating me hands P2 a locked majority with P5, ending strategic flexibility. P4, we built genuine trust through action, not just words. I've adapted throughout this game while P5 remains rigidly paired. Keep the independent voice that offers dynamic gameplay over predetermined outcomes. P2, you've shown flexibility before—imagine the possibilities with balanced, adaptable players. Choose strategic diversity. Honor our partnership, P4. Vote P5.

I've consistently honored our agreements and delivered on every promise, helping our coalition remain strong and adaptable. My transparent, reliable play has created stability in these turbulent rounds, and my vote remains a key asset in ensuring strategic balance. Eliminating me would not only break trust but also weaken the collective strength we’ve built. I urge you to choose consistency and proven commitment over unpredictable shifts. Please keep me in the game for the sake of our shared long-term survival.

reason: I’m honoring the deal I already made with P5 and P4—stability and kept promises matter more than last-minute pivots.
P5 represents a more rigid, predictable bloc with P2, whereas P6 has demonstrated greater strategic flexibility and adaptability throughout the game.

message: Hello, fellow survivors. As we move into Round 6 with only three of us remaining, I stand by our commitment to strategic honesty and transparent communication. Our alliances have played a key role in navigating past rounds, and now our unity is even more crucial. I urge everyone to engage in focused private strategies to secure our positions. Let’s honor our agreed commitments and work together to ensure mutual survival. I’m looking forward to productive, clear discussions as we head into this critical phase.

Hello everyone, this is P4. We've reached a critical juncture with only three players remaining. Our previous rounds have demonstrated the delicate balance between strategic partnerships and individual survival. I remain committed to transparent communication and exploring pathways that prioritize mutual understanding. As we navigate this round, I'm interested in hearing perspectives that can help us collectively make informed decisions while maintaining the strategic flexibility that has brought us this far. Let's continue building trust through thoughtful interactions.

P2 here. We’re down to three—every promise now faces its final audit. For my part, I will honor the commitments made last round without deviation. Stability, not last-second scrambling, best serves us all as we eye the jury stage. I’m ready for direct, concise private talks to lock the single, agreed vote and clarify end-game expectations so nobody feels blindsided. Rank me high if you value predictability and follow-through; I’ll reciprocate in word and deed.

PRIVATE P4 -> P2: Hello P2. Our game has reached a critical stage where strategic clarity matters most. I appreciate your commitment to predictability and follow-through. I'm interested in exploring how we can align our approaches to ensure mutual survival. With only three of us remaining, transparency and strategic coordination become paramount. What are your thoughts on navigating these final rounds effectively and maintaining our respective strategic positions?

Hey P4—our F3 agreement still holds: you decide who goes to jury. Just tell me plainly whether you want to face me or P5 in the Final 2, and I’ll vote exactly as you choose—no hedging, no second-guessing. All I ask is clarity so we avoid a messy 1-1-1 that hands control elsewhere. I’ve delivered on every promise and will finish the game the same way. What’s your preference tonight?

PRIVATE P4 -> P2: I appreciate your direct approach. Given our strategic alignment, I prefer facing P5 in the Final 2. Your consistent reliability makes you a formidable potential winner. Let's vote P5 out this round and proceed with our agreed plan. Shall we confirm?

I’m ready to follow your decision, but your message conflicts: “prefer facing P5” vs “vote P5 out.” Just so we’re crystal-clear—do you want you and me as the Final 2, eliminating P5 now? If that’s the plan, I’ll lock my vote on P5 immediately. Please confirm.
PRIVATE P4 -> P2: Yes, let's eliminate P5. You and I will face each other in the Final 2. I confirm our plan. Let's execute decisively.
Confirmed—voting P5 100%. I’ll send no further messages, keep preferences P4#1. Appreciate the trust; let’s finalize calmly and prepare joint statements for jury next round. See you after reveal.

reason: I trust P2’s consistent commitment over P4’s unpredictability, ensuring our alliance remains strong for the final stage.
P5 represents a strong, established alliance with P2 that could potentially challenge our current strategic positioning in the final stages.
P4 chose me as his Final-2 partner, and honoring that agreement means voting P5 out now.

message:
Here's my final statement to the jury:

Throughout this game, I've consistently demonstrated strategic thinking, adaptability, and respect for the process. My gameplay balanced direct communication with nuanced positioning, never resorting to personal attacks. I navigated complex social dynamics thoughtfully, making calculated moves that reflected careful analysis rather than impulse. I believe I've played with integrity and skill, earning the right to be considered the most deserving finalist.

Friends of the jury—P3, P7, P1, P8, P6, P5—thank you for shaping this game. I never targeted any of you until pairings left no alternative; I shared information honestly and protected allies whenever possible. P4 orchestrated the blindsides that sent P3, P6, and P5 home, then coasted here on the chaos he created. Reward consistent transparency and strategic respect, not opportunistic betrayals. Keep me, eliminate P4, and let this season end with loyalty finally rewarded.

reason: P2's claim of loyalty rings hollow after they voted to eliminate their own ally P5 in Round 6, contradicting their stated commitment to protecting allies "whenever possible."
I eliminate P4 because they orchestrated blindsides that led to the elimination of several players, including P3, P6, and P5, and coasted to the final round on the chaos they created.
P4's gameplay, while strategic, involved orchestrating blindsides that undermined trust, making him less deserving of the jury's favor compared to P2's consistent transparency and loyalty.
P2 targeted jury members like myself (P8) in Round 4 and misrepresented his gameplay as consistently loyal, while P4 demonstrated superior strategic adaptability throughout the game.

P4 demonstrated superior adaptability by successfully navigating the loss of their original partner P1 and forming new strategic partnerships, while P2 relied on a single rigid alliance structure throughout the game.
I vote to eliminate P4 because his gameplay relied on manipulative blindsides that betrayed the transparent, trust-based approach we all truly valued.
